courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: The Study of Music
courses.description: This course explores music as a fundamental human practice, and introduces the study of music as central to broader humanistic inquiry. By engaging with styles and performance practices from various regions and historical eras, students will develop an understanding of the diverse ways in which music intersects with human experience, culture, and history. To this end, the course employs an issue-based approach. The first several class sessions deal with fundamental questions about music, such as: What is music? How do musical sounds communicate meaning? What are the relationships between musical sounds, contexts, listening habits, and human behavior? How and why do scholars study music? The remainder of the semester is devoted to particular case studies that explore music’s relationship to other realms including politics, religion, identity, and globalization. The class is structured around interactive lectures, demonstrations, discussion, and in-class group activities. No prior musical background or training is required.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Choral Singing I

schedule.class_attributes: Can, change to Eng if needed

courses.description: MUSC1001, 1002, 2001, 2002, 3001, 3002, 4001, 4002 form a series of 8 courses which must be taken in sequence. The first six are required, whereas the others are elective. The arts of singing in the choir. Repertoires will be chosen from the Medieval Period to the present time.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Choral Singing II

schedule.class_attributes: Can, change to Eng if needed

courses.description: MUSC1001, 1002, 2001, 2002, 3001, 3002, 4001, 4002 form a series of 8 courses which must be taken in sequence. The first six are required, whereas the others are elective. The arts of singing in the choir. Repertoires will be chosen from the Medieval Period to the present time.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Applied Music (Minor I)
courses.description: This course focuses on the study of voice or any approved instrument (Western and non-Western). Advisory: For Music Majors and Minors only.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Applied Music (Major IX)
courses.description: This course focuses on the study of voice or any approved instrument (Western and non-Western). Advisory: For Music Majors only.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: African Drumming I
courses.description: This course provides practical study of drumming selected from traditions in Africa, especially West Africa, and/or the diaspora. Techniques for playing djembe and other drum and percussion instruments are taught in conjunction with associated vocal and movement gestures.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Chamber Music Ensemble I
courses.description: This course familiarizes students with the theoretical and practical aspects of performance in chamber music ensembles. Ensemble groups should normally consist of three or more players, and each student is allowed to join one group only. Students enrolling in this course must obtain permission from the teachers concerned, who may hold an audition.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Chinese Music Ensemble I
courses.description: This course provides practical study of various Chinese instrumental genres from different regions of China, as well as modern arrangements and new compositions for Chinese instruments.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Early Music Ensemble I
courses.description: This course provides students with opportunities to explore the vast world of early music through performance on replica period instruments. In consultation with the instructor, students select appropriate works from the repertoire, which ranges from antiquity through the early Classical era. Students prepare for an end-of-semester concert in weekly rehearsals that guide them through issues of technical proficiency, ensemble playing, stylistic accuracy, and creative expression.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Javanese Gamelan Ensemble I
courses.description: This course provides practical study of Javanese gamelan music, theory and aesthetics.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Jazz Ensemble I
courses.description: Jazz Ensemble provides practical study of traditional and contemporary jazz literature in a variety of idioms and styles. Students prepare for an end-of-semester concert in weekly rehearsals that enable them to develop their technical proficiency, stylistic accuracy, improvisation skills, and creative expression.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: New Music Ensemble I
courses.description: Through this course, students will become acquainted with contemporary new music performance, and become familiar with the contemporary music repertoire as well as associated rehearsal and ensemble techniques. The focus of the course will be the interpretation of Contemporary Music. An end-of-term performance will be organized as a project.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Applied Music (Minor II)
courses.description: This course focuses on the study of voice or any approved instrument (Western and non-Western). Advisory: For Music Majors and Minors only.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: New Music Ensemble II
courses.description: Through this course, students will become acquainted with contemporary new music performance, and become familiar with the contemporary music repertoire as well as associated rehearsal and ensemble techniques. The focus of the course will be the interpretation of Contemporary Music. An end-of-term performance will be organized as a project.

courses.title: Orchestral Training I

schedule.class_attributes: Can, change to Eng if needed

courses.description: Through playing in a chamber orchestra, students get acquainted with orchestral playing, orchestral repertoires and rehearsal procedure. End-of-term concert will be organized as a regular project.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Fundamentals of Tonal Music I
courses.description: A systematic introduction of tonal harmonic vocabulary that integrates part-writing, analysis, and aural training.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Fundamentals of Tonal Music II
courses.description: A continuation of the concepts covered in MUSC1212.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite: MUSC1212

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Applied Music (Major III)
courses.description: This course focuses on the study of voice or any approved instrument (Western and non-Western). Advisory: For Music Majors only.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Applied Music (Major IV)
courses.description: This course focuses on the study of voice or any approved instrument (Western and non-Western). Students must attend a jury of the major instrument/voice at the end of the second term annually. Advisory: For Music Majors only.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Hymnology and Liturgical Music
courses.description: A general history of hymnology and of liturgical music with special emphasis on its relevance to present day needs.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Materials and Structures of Music
courses.description: The study of tonal harmonic practice in Western music, with an emphasis on the operating principles behind the structuring of materials.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite: MUSC1222 or by consent of the instructor

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Advanced Harmonic Practice
courses.description: This is a more in-depth study of the harmonic techniques used by western composers in the classical and romantic period, with special emphasis on developing students’ ability to analyze and write in the various important harmonic styles concerned.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite: MUSC2252 OR by consent of the instructor.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Music Information Technology
courses.description: This course introduces the usage and the application of the most up-to-date computer and electronic technology in the field of music. Emphasis will be placed on the theory and practice of computer music software and knowledge of various recording media.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Aural Practice and Perception I
courses.description: This course provides training sessions and conveys methodologies of practical aural skills comprehending aspects of melody, harmony and rhythm as well as topics of understanding music appearance and aural analysis.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Pre-requisite: Grade B or above in MUSC1222 or permission by the instructor

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Aural Practice and Perception II
courses.description: This course provides training sessions and conveys methodologies of practical aural skills comprehending aspects of melody, harmony and rhythm as well as topics of understanding music appearance and aural analysis.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Pre-requisite: MUSC2511 or permission by the instructor.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: An Introduction to Arts Management
courses.description: This course aims to introduce students to key aspects and concepts of arts management as well as examine how musicians can make useful application of them. In addition to learning how to design and execute a music/arts project, students will undertake a critical study of the arts/cultural ecology in Hong Kong which affects the management of all local arts institutions. These knowledge and insights would enhance students’ abilities to promote and disseminate music/arts to the community.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Music in World Cultures
courses.description: A study of several selected musical cultures from around the world, including Asia, Africa, Europe, Oceania, and the Americas. Emphasis is placed on listening to and understanding musical styles within native contexts.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite: MUSC2552 or permission by the instructor.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Conducting
courses.description: A practical application. Students will study the techniques of conducting choirs, orchestras and small ensembles.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Music Therapy
courses.description: This course introduces students to two well-known approaches to music therapy (Behavioural Music Therapy and Psychodynamic Music Therapy) and explores the application of these approaches in education, rehabilitation, psychotherapy and personal development. The learning activities include lecture, group discussion, video watching, listening to music, reading and role-play. Students will be required to play a musical instrument in the role-play as demonstration and assessment. Therefore, students must have attained at least Grade 5 in one musical instrument (excluding voice) in the examination of the Associated Board of the Royal Schools of Music, or equivalent level for a Chinese musical instrument.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Music, Culture and Society
courses.description: Focusing on ethnographic perspective of music studies, the course explores the relationship between music, culture and society. Musical examples will be drawn from Western, Chinese, and other societies.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Foundations of Chinese Music
courses.description: This course is designed to introduce basic historical concepts and genres of Chinese music to students. It provides a comprehensive theoretical framework and understanding of existing genres in Chinese music, and it also tries to stress the relevance to history and the modern world. This will be a foundation for further studies of Chinese music.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Chinese Instrumental Music
courses.description: The history, style and repertoire of various instruments are studied. Students are required to perform or to attend live performances.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Chinese Operatic Music
courses.description: Discussion of the structural and theoretical aspects of Chinese opera, including the classification of vocal music, tuning and performance practice. The course focuses on Cantonese opera, but also covers other regional genres such as Beijing and Kun operas.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: History of Western Music I
courses.description: Through critical listening and reading assignments, this course introduces students to the history of Western music from antiquity until the eighteenth century. Students explore issues of musical style and analysis, as well as the cultural significance of music in Western society. Emphasis is placed on understanding music in its historical contexts, and developing skills for interpreting medieval and early modern repertoires. The successful completion of MUSC2872 will provide students with a foundation for other classes in Western music history.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: History of Western Music II
courses.description: Through critical listening and reading assignments, this course introduces students to the history of Western music from the eighteenth century to the present. Students explore issues of musical style and analysis, as well as the cultural significance of music in Western society. Emphasis is placed on understanding music in its historical contexts, and developing skills for interpreting Classical, Romantic, Modern and Postmodern repertoires. The successful completion of MUSC2882 will provide students with a foundation for other classes in Western music history designed to explore individual topics in depth.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Selected Study I
courses.description: The study of a selected topic or topics proposed by the student and approved by the teacher concerned. This topic can be of Western or non-Western music subject to the availability of the teacher. A portfolio or paper should be submitted at the end of the course.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Choral Singing V

courses.description: MUSC1001, 1002, 2001, 2002, 3001, 3002, 4001, 4002 form a series of 8 courses which must be taken in sequence. The first six are required, whereas the others are elective. courses.subject: MUSC

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: History of Western Music: Special Topic I
courses.description: Specialized historical or genre studies exploring aspects of music creation, analysis, or performance of Western music. A substantial oral presentation and/or research paper will be required during each term.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Pre-requisite: MUSC2813 and 2823 (for 3-year cohort) OR MUSC2872 and 2882 (for 4-year cohort) OR by consent of the instructor.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: History of Western Music: Special Topic II
courses.description: Specialized historical or genre studies exploring aspects of music creation, analysis, or performance of Western music. A substantial oral presentation and/or research paper will be required during each term.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Pre-requisite: MUSC2813 and 2823 (for 3-year cohort) OR MUSC2872 and 2882 (for 4-year cohort) OR by consent of the instructor.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: History of Western Music: Special Topic III
courses.description: Specialized historical or genre studies exploring aspects of music creation, analysis, or performance of Western music. A substantial oral presentation and/or research paper will be required during each term.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Pre-requisite: MUSC2872 and MUSC2882 OR by consent of the instructor

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: History of Western Music: Special Topic IV
courses.description: Specialized historical or genre studies exploring aspects of music creation, analysis, or performance of Western music. A substantial oral presentation and/or research paper will be required during each term.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Pre-requisite: MUSC2872 and MUSC2882 OR by consent of the instructor

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Counterpoint (Tonal and Modern)
courses.description: The study of contrapuntal techniques used between 1700 and the present, including the writing of fugue.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite: MUSC2262 or permission by the instructor.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Orchestral Techniques
courses.description: A practical guide to the art of orchestration.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite: MUSC2262 or permission by the instructor.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Composition I
courses.description: The techniques of composition will be studied including the various aspects of linear and horizontal techniques. A portfolio of work in progress must be submitted at the end of the term.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite: Grade B or above in MUSC3212 or MUSC2262, and departmental permission must be obtained prior to registration.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Composition II
courses.description: Continuation of MUSC3343. A portfolio of completed music compositions must be submitted at the end of the term.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite: MUSC3343

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Composition III
courses.description: Continuation of MUSC3353. A portfolio of completed music compositions must be submitted at the end of the term.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite: MUSC3353.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Scoring for Film and Television
courses.description: This course introduces the technique of scoring for motion pictures and television, including music for commercials, dramatic film, animated film, documentaries and television episodes. Emphasis is placed on developing technical skills and encouraging student creativity.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite: MUSC2333 or permission by the instructor.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Electronic Music
courses.description: History and repertoire of electronic music, basic principles of electronic music and sound theory, introduction to MIDI and its applications, notation software, digital recording and editing. Emphasis will be placed on the practical nature of the processes with students involved in the course assignments. Knowledge in music information technology is preferred. There will be an interview before the start of an academic year.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Tonal Music Analysis
courses.description: Analytical studies of formal archetypes and musical works from the Western tonal tradition. Emphasis will be placed on the harmonic principles underlying music in various genres and styles from the common practice period and how these may serve expressive goals.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite: MUSC2252 or permission by the instructor.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Post-tonal Music Analysis
courses.description: Continuation of MUSC3432. A critical survey and review of canonical post-tonal theories through the analyses of selected works from the late nineteenth through the first half of the twentieth century, with emphasis on the music of Bartók, Debussy, Schoenberg, Stravinsky, and Webern.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite: MUSC3432 or permission by the instructor.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Theory and Analysis: Special Topic I
courses.description: Introduction and exploration of advanced music-analytical methodologies and/or theoretical issues in relation to particular composers, styles or repertoires.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Theory and Analysis: Special Topic II
courses.description: Introduction and exploration of advanced music-analytical methodologies and/or theoretical issues in relation to particular composers, styles or repertoires.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Theory and Analysis: Special Topic III
courses.description: Introduction and exploration of advanced music-analytical methodologies and/or theoretical issues in relation to particular composers, styles or repertoires.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Theory and Analysis: Special Topic IV
courses.description: Introduction and exploration of advanced music-analytical methodologies and/or theoretical issues in relation to particular composers, styles or repertoires.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Analysis and Performance
courses.description: This course offers upper undergraduates the opportunity to explore the interactions between analysis and performance in tonal music. Factors that affect interpretative decisions such as the choice of editions, stylistic competency, historical performance practice, generic and formal expectations, rhythmic and metrical awareness, harmonic sensitivity and structural understanding will be addressed in turn. Concepts will be introduced primarily by way of scores and recordings, and readings will also be assigned where appropriate. Students should be prepared to engage in music making (singing and/or playing). This is a recommended course for performance stream students and an elective for others.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Vocal/Instrumental Pedagogy
courses.description: In this course, students explore historical and current approaches to teaching music. Through a combination of independent study and group work, each student will gain a broad knowledge of the approaches to musical instruction and thorough knowledge of the methods of teaching his or her primary instrument. Topics may include the teaching of voice, strings, winds, and percussion.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Chinese Music: History and Theory I
courses.description: A general study of the history and theory of Chinese music from the legendary to the pre-Zhou period (ca. 2100-1027 BCE) to the Tang Dynasty (618-907 CE).

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Chinese Music: History and Theory II
courses.description: A general study of the history and theory of Chinese music from the Song (960-1279 CE) to Qing (1644-1911 CE) dynasties.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Music Performer’s Issues
courses.description: What does it take for performers to deliver a secure performance on stage? Why can’t one deliver a successful performance despite endless hours of practice? Do performers still want to perform live when everybody has free access to world-class concerts online? This course examines challenges faced by performers and provides practical advices on issues including practice strategies, mental imagining, memorization, motivation, performance anxiety, injury prevention, collaboration among musicians, and creativity in music performance. Along with lectures on performers’ issues, students will engage in the study of their chosen repertoire and participate in discussion on related stylistic features and performance practice. All that cumulates into their final projects, interactive talk-performances where performers help audience members to listen, perform, create, and reflect in ways that heighten their musical perceptions.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Chinese Music: History and Theory III
courses.description: A general study of the history and theory of Chinese music from the post-Qing era (1911 CE) to the present.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Piano Pedagogy
courses.description: This course introduces students to methods of teaching piano. Through independent study and a variety of classroom activities, students will explore historical and current approaches to teaching piano, focusing on but not limited to the development of technique and selection of repertoire. All students should be studying piano as a first instrument.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Selected Topic in World Musics
courses.description: Focused study of music from a particular country or region other than China and Western Europe, such as India, Indonesia, the Middle East, West Africa, and Latin America.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Chinese Music: Selected Topics
courses.description: This course furthers the content of the foundation course in much greater depth. Selected examples of Chinese music will be covered with an emphasis on issues such as modernization and westernization in the 20th century. The course also highlights the challenges of Chinese music in the globalized world.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite: MUSC2562 or permission by the instructor.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Selected Topic in Music and Society
courses.description: Drawing upon current ethnomusicological theories and methods, the course explores selected issues in the social and cultural study of music such as nationalism in music, music and politics, music and religion.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Composition: Special Topic I
courses.description: An advanced study of compositional techniques and stylistic approaches in music.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Composition: Special Topic II
courses.description: An advanced study of compositional techniques and stylistic approaches in music.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Composition: Special Topic III
courses.description: An advanced study of compositional techniques and stylistic approaches in music.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Composition: Special Topic IV
courses.description: An advanced study of compositional techniques and stylistic approaches in music.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Introduction to Jazz
courses.description: This course examines the historical development of jazz from its origins to the present.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Pre-requisite: MUSC2813 and 2823 (for 3-year cohort) OR MUSC2872 and 2882 (for 4-year cohort) OR by consent of the instructor.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Romanticism in Music
courses.description: This course explores the impact of the Romantic movement on music, beginning in the early years of the 19th century.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Pre-requisite: MUSC2813 and 2823 (for 3-year cohort) OR MUSC2872 and 2882 (for 4-year cohort) OR by consent of the instructor.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Music on Record
courses.description: This course explores the history of sound recording, from the late 19th century to the present day, examining the connections between technology and commerce and their effects on music making.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Pre-requisite: MUSC2813 and 2823 (for 3-year cohort) OR MUSC2872 and 2882 (for 4-year cohort) OR by consent of the instructor.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Approaches to Popular Music
courses.description: The course provides a grounding in approaches to thinking and writing about popular music critically, with some theoretical and musicological background in musical, historical, and cultural issues. It explores a variety of approaches, perspectives, and key issues in relation to featured songs, videos, and case studies. More broadly, it aims (i) to offer students a sense of the richness and diversity of approaches to popular music; (ii) to ask fundamental questions about the social location of popular music and its role in forming and responding to social practices; and (iii) to explore the interplay between popular music and broader cultural and historical phenomena.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Pre-requisite(s): MUSC2872 and MUSC2882 or permission by the instructor.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: History of Film Music
courses.description: This course explores the changing role of music in film from the 1890s through to the present and the place of film in Western music history.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Pre-requisite: MUSC2872 and MUSC2882 OR by consent of the instructor

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Music Pedagogy: Special Topic I
courses.description: A specialized study within music pedagogy. The focus of the course may be largely historical, theoretical, practical, or some combination of these. Regardless of the focus, each special topic will aim to expand the student’s conceptual understanding of teaching and learning music.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Music Pedagogy: Special Topic II
courses.description: A specialized study within music pedagogy. The focus of the course may be largely historical, theoretical, practical, or some combination of these. Regardless of the focus, each special topic will aim to expand the student’s conceptual understanding of teaching and learning music.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Selected Study II
courses.description: The study of a selected topic or topics proposed by the student and approved by the teacher concerned. This topic can be of Western or non-Western music subject to the availability of the teacher. A portfolio or paper should be submitted at the end of the course.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Music Pedagogy: Special Topic III
courses.description: A specialized study within music pedagogy. The focus of the course may be largely historical, theoretical, practical, or some combination of these. Regardless of the focus, each special topic will aim to expand the student’s conceptual understanding of teaching and learning music.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Selected Study III
courses.description: The study of a selected topic or topics proposed by the student and approved by the teacher concerned. This topic can be of Western or non-Western music subject to the availability of the teacher. A portfolio or paper should be submitted at the end of the course.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Music Pedagogy: Special Topic IV
courses.description: A specialized study within music pedagogy. The focus of the course may be largely historical, theoretical, practical, or some combination of these. Regardless of the focus, each special topic will aim to expand the student’s conceptual understanding of teaching and learning music.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Senior Recital Preparation

schedule.class_attributes: Cantonese and English Capstone Course STOT Course

courses.description: The course consists of instruction on the student’s major instrument with an applied music instructor and the planning of a 45-minute recital programme to take place in the following term. This course may only be taken in the penultimate term. Advisory: For Music Majors only.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Choral Singing VII

schedule.class_attributes: Can, change to Eng if needed

courses.description: MUSC1001, 1002, 2001, 2002, 3001, 3002, 4001, 4002 form a series of 8 courses which must be taken in sequence. The first six are required, whereas the others are elective. The arts of singing in the choir. Repertoires will be chosen from the Medieval Period to the present time.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Choral Singing VIII

schedule.class_attributes: Can, change to Eng if needed

courses.description: MUSC1001, 1002, 2001, 2002, 3001, 3002, 4001, 4002 form a series of 8 courses which must be taken in sequence. The first six are required, whereas the others are elective. The arts of singing in the choir. Repertoires will be chosen from the Medieval Period to the present time.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Senior Recital

schedule.class_attributes: Cantonese and English Capstone Course STOT Course

courses.description: This course is offered to students of high performing standard to give a senior recital in their final term of study, and will consist of instruction on the student’s major instrument with an applied music instructor, formal performance of a 45-minute recital programme, and presentation of bilingual (English and Chinese) programme notes for works in the programme. Repetition of works performed in previous Jury examinations must not exceed 50%. Students should arrange for their own accompanists. This course may only be taken in the final term of study. Advisory: For Music Majors only.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite: MUSC4000

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Applied Music (Minor VII)
courses.description: This course focuses on the study of voice or any approved instrument (Western and non-Western). Advisory: For Music Majors and Minors only.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Applied Music (Major XV)
courses.description: This course focuses on the study of voice or any approved instrument (Western and non-Western). Advisory: For Music Majors only.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: African Drumming VII
courses.description: This course provides practical study of drumming selected from traditions in Africa, especially West Africa, and/or the diaspora. Techniques for playing djembe and other drum and percussion instruments are taught in conjunction with associated vocal and movement gestures.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Chamber Music Ensemble VII
courses.description: This course familiarizes students with the theoretical and practical aspects of performance in chamber music ensembles. Ensemble groups should normally consist of three or more players, and each student is allowed to join one group only. Students enrolling in this course must obtain permission from the teachers concerned, who may hold an audition.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Chinese Music Ensemble VII
courses.description: This course provides practical study of various Chinese instrumental genres from different regions of China, as well as modern arrangements and new compositions for Chinese instruments.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Early Music Ensemble VII
courses.description: This course provides students with opportunities to explore the vast world of early music through performance on replica period instruments. In consultation with the instructor, students select appropriate works from the repertoire, which ranges from antiquity through the early Classical era. Students prepare for an end-of-semester concert in weekly rehearsals that guide them through issues of technical proficiency, ensemble playing, stylistic accuracy, and creative expression.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Javanese Gamelan Ensemble VII
courses.description: This course provides practical study of Javanese gamelan music, theory and aesthetics.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Jazz Ensemble VII
courses.description: Jazz Ensemble provides practical study of traditional and contemporary jazz literature in a variety of idioms and styles. Students prepare for an end-of-semester concert in weekly rehearsals that enable them to develop their technical proficiency, stylistic accuracy, improvisation skills, and creative expression.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: New Music Ensemble VII
courses.description: Through this course, students will become acquainted with contemporary new music performance, and become familiar with the contemporary music repertoire as well as associated rehearsal and ensemble techniques. The focus of the course will be the interpretation of Contemporary Music. An end-of-term performance will be organized as a project.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Applied Music (Minor VIII)
courses.description: This course focuses on the study of voice or any approved instrument (Western and non-Western). Advisory: For Music Majors and Minors only.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Applied Music (Major XVI)
courses.description: This course focuses on the study of voice or any approved instrument (Western and non-Western). Students must attend a jury of the major instrument/voice at the end of the second term annually. Advisory: For Music Majors only.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: African Drumming VIII
courses.description: This course provides practical study of drumming selected from traditions in Africa, especially West Africa, and/or the diaspora. Techniques for playing djembe and other drum and percussion instruments are taught in conjunction with associated vocal and movement gestures.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Chamber Music Ensemble VIII
courses.description: This course familiarizes students with the theoretical and practical aspects of performance in chamber music ensembles. Ensemble groups should normally consist of three or more players, and each student is allowed to join one group only. Students enrolling in this course must obtain permission from the teachers concerned, who may hold an audition.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Chinese Music Ensemble VIII
courses.description: This course provides practical study of various Chinese instrumental genres from different regions of China, as well as modern arrangements and new compositions for Chinese instruments.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Early Music Ensemble VIII
courses.description: This course provides students with opportunities to explore the vast world of early music through performance on replica period instruments. In consultation with the instructor, students select appropriate works from the repertoire, which ranges from antiquity through the early Classical era. Students prepare for an end-of-semester concert in weekly rehearsals that guide them through issues of technical proficiency, ensemble playing, stylistic accuracy, and creative expression.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Javanese Gamelan Ensemble VIII
courses.description: This course provides practical study of Javanese gamelan music, theory and aesthetics.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Jazz Ensemble VIII
courses.description: Jazz Ensemble provides practical study of traditional and contemporary jazz literature in a variety of idioms and styles. Students prepare for an end-of-semester concert in weekly rehearsals that enable them to develop their technical proficiency, stylistic accuracy, improvisation skills, and creative expression.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: New Music Ensemble VIII
courses.description: Through this course, students will become acquainted with contemporary new music performance, and become familiar with the contemporary music repertoire as well as associated rehearsal and ensemble techniques. The focus of the course will be the interpretation of Contemporary Music. An end-of-term performance will be organized as a project.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Orchestral Training VII

schedule.class_attributes: Can, change to Eng if needed

courses.description: Through playing in a chamber orchestra, students get acquainted with orchestral playing, orchestral repertoires and rehearsal procedure. End-of-term concert will be organized as a regular project.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Orchestral Training VIII

schedule.class_attributes: Can, change to Eng if needed

courses.description: Through playing in a chamber orchestra, students get acquainted with orchestral playing, orchestral repertoires and rehearsal procedure. End-of-term concert will be organized as a regular project.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Wind Orchestra VII

schedule.class_attributes: Can, change to Eng if needed

courses.description: Through this course, students will become acquainted with wind orchestra performance, and become familiar with the concert band repertoire as well as associated rehearsal techniques. End-of-term concert will be organized as a project.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Wind Orchestra VIII

schedule.class_attributes: Can, change to Eng if needed

courses.description: Through this course, students will become acquainted with wind orchestra performance, and become familiar with the concert band repertoire as well as associated rehearsal techniques. End-of-term concert will be organized as a project.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Applied Music (Major VII)
courses.description: This course focuses on the study of voice or any approved instrument (Western and non-Western). Advisory: For Music Majors only.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Applied Music (Major VIII)
courses.description: This course focuses on the study of voice or any approved instrument (Western and non-Western). Students must attend a jury of the major instrument/voice at the end of the second term annually. Advisory: For Music Majors only.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Research Methods in Music
courses.description: This course introduces students in the research stream to various tools and methods for undertaking music scholarship. Each student will select and explore a topic of interest during the term, culminating in an oral presentation and research paper. This course also includes practical units on professional development that are geared toward building a successful career in academia.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite(s): MUSC2262 and MUSC2882 (or permission by the instructor)

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Senior Pedagogy Project I

schedule.class_attributes: Cantonese and English Capstone Course STOT Course
Cantonese and English Capstone Course STOT Course
Cantonese and English Capstone Course STOT Course
Cantonese and English Capstone Course STOT Course
Cantonese and English Capstone Course STOT Course

courses.description: This course forms the first half of a two-part capstone course in music pedagogy, in which students consolidate what they have learned in foundation courses. The capstone comprises a number of elements and may include observation of teaching practice, either in local schools or in private teaching studios; development of teaching materials; and writing an extended essay. In this course, in consultation with the course supervisor, students will devise a research plan and explore related pedagogical literature.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Co-requisite(s): MUSC4243

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Senior Pedagogy Project II

schedule.class_attributes: Cantonese and English Capstone Course STOT Course
Cantonese and English Capstone Course STOT Course
Cantonese and English Capstone Course STOT Course
Cantonese and English Capstone Course STOT Course
Cantonese and English Capstone Course STOT Course

courses.description: This course forms the second half of a two-part capstone course in music pedagogy, in which students consolidate what they have learned in foundation courses. The capstone comprises a number of elements and may include observation of teaching practice, either in local schools or in private teaching studios; development of teaching materials; and writing an extended essay. In this course, students will carry out the project that they have researched and planned in MUSC4513.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite: MUSC4513

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Senior Research Project I
courses.description: This course forms the first of a two-part course for capstone research projects in Music. It introduces students to the requisite scholarly and practical skills for conducting such projects.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Senior Research Project II
courses.description: This course forms the second of a two-part course for capstone research projects in Music. Students will complete an extended independent research project under the supervision of a Music faculty member. The topic, contents, and other particulars of the project are to be determined in consultation with the Supervisor.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Pre-requisite: MUSC4613

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Senior Thesis I

schedule.class_attributes: Cantonese and English Capstone Course STOT Course
Cantonese and English Capstone Course STOT Course
Cantonese and English Capstone Course STOT Course
English only Capstone Course STOT Course
Cantonese and English Capstone Course STOT Course
Cantonese and English Capstone Course STOT Course
Cantonese and English Capstone Course STOT Course

courses.description: Preparatory stage of an independent research project on a topic of the student’s own choice. Approval of the Undergraduate Programme Committee required prior to registration. To be followed by MUSC4823.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Co-requisite(s): MUSC4243

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Senior Thesis II

schedule.class_attributes: Cantonese and English Capstone Course STOT Course
Cantonese and English Capstone Course STOT Course
Cantonese and English Capstone Course STOT Course
English only Capstone Course STOT Course
Cantonese and English Capstone Course STOT Course
Cantonese and English Capstone Course STOT Course
Cantonese and English Capstone Course STOT Course

courses.description: Conclusive stage of an independent research project on a topic of the student’s own choice, subject to approval by the Undergraduate Programme Committee.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite: MUSC4813

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Introduction to Transcription and Analysis
courses.description: Methods and techniques employed in particular reference to Chinese music.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Chinese Music Study: Special Topic I
courses.description: Detailed study of a special topic is required. Students will write a paper. Permission of the teacher concerned must be obtained prior to registration. To be followed by MUSC4893.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisites: one from MUSC3512, 3522, 3532 and one from MUSC2612, 2622; but strongly recommended MUSC4862, or permission by the instructor.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Chinese Music Study: Special Topic II
courses.description: Detailed study of a special topic is required. Students will write a paper. Permission of the teacher concerned must be obtained prior to registration.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite: MUSC4883 or permission by the instructor.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Selected Study IV
courses.description: The study of a selected topic or topics proposed by the student and approved by the teacher concerned. This topic can be of Western or non-Western music subject to the availability of the teacher. A portfolio or paper should be submitted at the end of the course.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Traditional Musical Culture in China
courses.description: Covering significant issues and topics in the study of Chinese music history, this course focuses on traditional Chinese music and its relevance to modern society. It aims to expose students to both Chinese and international scholarship by means of an up-to-date discussion of the historiography of Chinese music.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For MA Music

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Musical Culture in Contemporary China
courses.description: Focusing on the modernization, westernization and globalization faced by the Chinese since the early 20th century, this course deals with the survival, positioning and cultural environment of Chinese music. Based on recent scholarly discourse in China and the West, the course takes a multi-disciplinary approach to the study of contemporary Chinese music.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For MA Music

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Music and Popular Culture in Hong Kong
courses.description: Music and culture are the points of departure. Popular song and film of Hong Kong are studied in relationship to the unique political, historical and cultural position of Hong Kong. The issue of identity will be further explored from the perspectives of cultural studies, ethnomusicology and musicology.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For MA Music

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Music in Film
courses.description: This course examines the role of music in film. It enables students with no training in music or media studies to better appreciate the art of film music. Through lectures and assignments that comprise viewing, reading, and listening, students gain skills to critically evaluate what they see and hear in feature films, animated films, music videos, and advertisements.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For MA Music

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Music-Making in Global Contexts
courses.description: This course provides an in depth study of how music is created and performed in various selected music cultures across the globe, with particular emphasis placed on how aesthetic systems of all types (classical, folk, popular, etc.) shape and are shaped by socio-cultural factors and mechanisms, such as place, identity, social structure, globalization, and social change.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For MA Music

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Special Topic I in “Music and Society”
courses.description: The study of a selected topic under 'Music and Society', proposed either by students or by the programme coordinator after consultation with students. The topic can be of Western or non-Western music, subject to the availability of the teacher. A paper (or, in the case of practical subjects, a portfolio or a musical presentation) should be delivered at the end of the course.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For MA Music

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Special Topic II in 'Music and Society'
courses.description: The study of a selected topic under 'Music and Society', proposed either by students or by the programme coordinator after consultation with students. The topic can be of Western or non-Western music, subject to the availability of the teacher. A paper (or, in the case of practical subjects, a portfolio or a musical presentation) should be delivered at the end of the course.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For MA Music

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Music Management and Promotion
courses.description: The aim of the course is to enable students to learn the theoretical concepts of music management and promotion as well as to examine how these are applied in various music industries in Hong Kong. Students will thus acquire a better understanding of the context and the dissemination of music in the Hong Kong community. Their perspectives on music promotion and ability to analyze critical issues relating to music and society will be enhanced.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For MA Music

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Advanced Tonal Skills
courses.description: The course is designed as a conceptual and practical study of the harmonic materials of music of the common practice period, with equal emphasis on developing students’ written and aural skills as well as analytical and creative abilities. It prepares students for more advanced composing and arranging courses with in-depth study of the harmonic techniques used by western composers the eighteenth and nineteenth centuries, placing special emphasis on developing the students’ ability to analyze and write in various important styles concerned.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For MA Music

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Practical Composing and Arranging
courses.description: The course is designed as a practical guide, leading the arranger (as a composer) through the entire process of creative imagination to the completion of an arrangement and the preparation of a score. Students are introduced to the concepts of melodic construction, harmonic expansion, rhythmic elaboration, and techniques of modulation and variation. They will be given assignments to score for various texture types, compose introductions, transitions and codas, develop accompaniment styles, and to plan the form of an arrangement. Emphasis will be given to practical scoring for specifi c groups, such as for church and school choir, wind band and chamber orchestra. Considerations in popular music will also be discussed. Prerequisite: attained at least ABRSM Grade 8 (or equivalent) in theory.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For MA Music

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Advanced Music Information Technology
courses.description: This course introduces the usage and the application of the most up-to-date computer, audio engineering and electronic technology. Emphasis will be placed on both the theory and practicalities of computer music software and its application in the classroom and church. Students need to do studio work.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For MA Music

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Writing Music for the Church
courses.description: The course is an extension of MUS8009. Designed in the form of a workshop, students are guided through the process of planning and developing a musical work along with the actual making of the music in class. Emphasis will be given to developing skills typically required for the church musician, including those of keyboard improvisation, practical scoring for ensembles of limited resource, musical setting for congregational hymns, and the writing of descant, varied accompaniment, worship chorus and anthem, etc. (Prerequisite: attained at least ABRSM Grade 8 Theory or equivalent. Students who have taken MUS8009 will be given priority.)
courses.enrollment_requirement: For MA Music

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Entrepreneurship and New Vision in Music
courses.description: This course aims to broaden students’ outlook on how music can connect with and add value to contemporary society. It introduces students to basic concepts of entrepreneurship and major toolkits used by entrepreneurs in planning their business ventures. It also examines different local and overseas cases which demonstrate new vision in music, both of commercial nature and for social good.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For MA Music

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Special Topic III in ‘Music, Industry, and Creativity’
courses.description: The study of a selected topic under 'Music, Industry, and Creativity', proposed either by students or by the programme coordinator after consultation with students. The topic can be of Western or non-Western music, subject to the availability of the teacher. A paper (or, in the case of practical subjects, a portfolio or a musical presentation) should be delivered at the end of the course.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For MA Music

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Special Topic IV in ‘Music, Industry, and Creativity’
courses.description: The study of a selected topic under ‘Music, Industry, and Creativity’ , proposed either by students or by the programme coordinator after consultation with students. The topic can be of Western or non-Western music, subject to the availability of the teacher. A paper (or, in the case of practical subjects, a portfolio or a musical presentation) should be delivered at the end of the course.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For MA Music

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Frontiers in Music Theory
courses.description: Course Objective: This is a course 1. For musicians who love to brush up on their analytical techniques for teaching, performance and understanding of music. 2. For musicians who want to have a birds-eye view on the new development of music theory in the last 50 years. 3. For music educators who want to be successful in "Aural Training"and the teaching of theory. Contents: This 12-week term course is designed to study the formal structures of music and to familiarize music students with some of the most useful analytical tools. Some of the topics may include the thematic process of music; post Schenkerian theory; post-tonal understanding of music; and how listen to music structurally.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For MA Music

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Style, Interpretation and Performance Practice
courses.description: This course focuses on the study of interpretation through the performance of selected pieces from various style periods. Students will prepare pieces for performance based on research into the relevant period, and through discussions of their performance. (Prerequisite: attained at least ABRSM Grade 8 or equivalent in any western instrument.)
courses.enrollment_requirement: For MA Music

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Western Opera & Vocal Literature
courses.description: A survey of Western opera and related vocal literature from Baroque to the present. Emphasis on exploring historical, stylistic, and aesthetic aspects of representative works and their leading composers through the perspectives of composer, performer, and audience. The classes will explore various opera scenes, songs and other vocal repertoire and their associated performance practice through historical and analytical reading, discussion and analysis of recorded performances, score reading, and source study. Along with weekly lectures, students participate in in-class discussions, complete class exercises, and work towards their final project presentations combining scholarly work and practical work.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For MA Music

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Western Instrumental Literature
courses.description: This course aims to familiarize students with major Solo, Chamber and Orchestral instrumental works from the 18th century to the contemporary period. Through regular listening and reading assignments, students will be able to explore the stylistic and analytical issues surrounding the genres of Western instrumental music, with emphasis on the relationships between musical form and genre, between genre and style, and how Western art music evolves through time.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For MA Music

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Practical Studies in Musicianship and Conducting (Choral)
courses.description: This course aims at enhancing students' understanding of the practical as well as intellectual aspects of musicianship that is specifically required in choral conducting. The course will cover topics such as score reading, vocal skills, style and interpretation, and rehearsal techniques. Students have to practise the skills with the vocal ensemble formed by members of the class. (Prerequisite: attained at least ABRSM Grade 8 or equivalent in any instrument. Voice audition may also be needed.)
courses.enrollment_requirement: For MA Music

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Practical Studies in Musicianship and Conducting (Orchestral)
courses.description: This course aims at enhancing students' understanding of the practical as well as intellectual aspects of musicianship that is specifically required in orchestral conducting. The course will cover topics such as score reading, instrumentation, style and interpretation, and rehearsal techniques. Students have to practice the skills with the piano in class and will work with an ensemble at the end of the course. (Prerequisite: attained at least ABRSM Grade 8 or equivalent in any instrument.)
courses.enrollment_requirement: For MA Music

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Special Topic V in 'Style and Interpretation'
courses.description: The study of a selected topic under 'Style and Interpretation', proposed either by students or by the programme coordinator after consultation with students. The topic can be of Western or non-Western music, subject to the availability of the teacher. A paper (or, in the case of practical subjects, a portfolio or a musical presentation) should be delivered at the end of the course.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For MA Music

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Special Topic VI in 'Style and Interpretation'
courses.description: The study of a selected topic under 'Style and Interpretation', proposed either by students or by the programme coordinator after consultation with students. The topic can be of Western or non-Western music, subject to the availability of the teacher. A paper (or, in the case of practical subjects, a portfolio or a musical presentation) should be delivered at the end of the course.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For MA Music

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Research Methods and Bibliography
courses.description: Location and use of sources, bibliographic methods, written and oral presentations of sample research projects.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in Doctor of Music, Master of Music, MPhil Music or PhD Music

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Independent Study I
courses.description: The area of study is to be determined by student and instructor. Student who wishes to take this course must consult his/her programme advisor and submit a study plan to the teacher concerned for approval. May be repeated once but on a different topic.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in Doctor of Music, Master of Music, MPhil Music or PhD Music

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Independent Study II
courses.description: The area of study is to be determined by student and instructor. Student who wishes to take this course must consult his/her programme advisor and submit a study plan to the teacher concerned for approval. May be repeated once but on a different topic.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in Doctor of Music, Master of Music, MPhil Music or PhD Music

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Advanced Composition I
courses.description: Writing music with a view to the development of technical control of materials, fluency and the expression of a personal style.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in Doctor of Music, Master of Music, MPhil Music or PhD Music

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Advanced Composition II
courses.description: Writing music with a view to the development of technical control of materials, fluency and the expression of a personal style.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in Doctor of Music, Master of Music, MPhil Music or PhD Music

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Computer-Aided Composition
courses.description: This course covers the application of digital and analog methods of data storage, processing and control in music. Students are not only guided to appreciate the aesthetics of electronic music, they are also given the opportunity to apply what they have learnt in the process of original music making.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in Doctor of Music, Master of Music, MPhil Music or PhD Music

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Ethnomusicology I: History and Theory
courses.description: Bibliography, history and theory of ethnomusicology.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in Doctor of Music, Master of Music, MPhil Music or PhD Music

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Ethnomusicology II: Current issues
courses.description: Bibliography, history and theory of ethnomusicology
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in Doctor of Music, Master of Music, MPhil Music or PhD Music;Prerequisite: MUSC6200

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Special Topic in Chinese Music I
courses.description: Addressing significant issues and topics in the study of Chinese music, the course aims to expose students to both Chinese and international scholarship by means of an up-to-date discussion of Chinese music.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in Doctor of Music, Master of Music, MPhil Music or PhD Music

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Special Topic in Chinese Music II
courses.description: Addressing significant issues and topics in the study of Chinese music, the course aims to expose students to both Chinese and international scholarship by means of an up-to-date discussion of Chinese music.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in Doctor of Music, Master of Music, MPhil Music or PhD Music

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Special Topic in Ethnomusicology I
courses.description: Advanced seminar in issues in ethnomusicology.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in Doctor of Music, Master of Music, MPhil Music or PhD Music

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Special Topic in Ethnomusicology II
courses.description: Advanced seminar in issues in ethnomusicology.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in Doctor of Music, Master of Music, MPhil Music or PhD Music

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Seminar in Musicology: Renaissance and Early Baroque Music
courses.description: Topics include a wide range of music and styles common from 1400 to 1700. Readings from pertinent letters, documents and treatises and the standard secondary literature.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in Doctor of Music, Master of Music, MPhil Music or PhD Music

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Seminar in Musicology: Late Baroque to 1870
courses.description: Development of musical culture and society within Europe during the eighteenth and early nineteenth centuries. Readings from the most influential historiographic literature. Discussion of current issues and debates within eighteenth- and nineteenth-century musical studies.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in Doctor of Music, Master of Music, MPhil Music or PhD Music

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Seminar in Musicology: From 1870 to the Present
courses.description: Significant musical trends and historiographic literature for this period. Primary emphasis is on Western music.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in Doctor of Music, Master of Music, MPhil Music or PhD Music

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Topics in Sacred Music
courses.description: Focus on liturgical, devotional and sacred Christian music prior to 1700.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in Doctor of Music, Master of Music, MPhil Music or PhD Music

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Topics in Western Opera
courses.description: Historical development of opera with focus on a composer, a group of composers, or a particular problem within opera studies. Opera as a cultural product peculiar to a specific historical context.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in Doctor of Music, Master of Music, MPhil Music or PhD Music

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Topics in the Orchestra and Its Music
courses.description: Orchestra in historic and social contexts; repertoire; leadership and co-ordination; and development of instrumentation.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in Doctor of Music, Master of Music, MPhil Music or PhD Music

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Musical Notation
courses.description: Study and transcription of selected examples from Medieval, Renaissance notation systems.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in Doctor of Music, Master of Music, MPhil Music or PhD Music

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Topics in Musicology I
courses.description: Specialized historical or genre studies exploring aspects of music creation, analysis, or performance of Western music. A substantial oral presentation and research paper will be required during the term.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in PhD/MPhil/DMus/MMus in Music

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Topics in Musicology II
courses.description: Specialized historical or genre studies exploring aspects of music creation, analysis, or performance of Western music. A substantial oral presentation and research paper will be required during the term.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in PhD/MPhil/DMus/MMus in Music

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Seminar in the Theory and Analysis of Music I
courses.description: Selected studies in music theory, comparative theory, history of music theory, acoustics and aesthetics.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in Doctor of Music, Master of Music, MPhil Music or PhD Music

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Advanced Tonal Music Theory and Analysis
courses.description: Analytical studies of the tonal repertory with emphasis on canonical techniques, underlying theories and the latest scholarship.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in Doctor of Music, Master of Music, MPhil Music or PhD Music

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Advanced Post-tonal Music Theory and Analysis
courses.description: Analytical studies of the post-tonal repertory with emphasis on canonical techniques, underlying theories and the latest scholarship.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in Doctor of Music, Master of Music, MPhil Music or PhD Music

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Seminar in the Theory and Analysis of Music II
courses.description: Selected studies in music theory, comparative theory, history of music theory, acoustics and aesthetics.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in Doctor of Music, Master of Music, MPhil Music or PhD Music

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Special Topics: Theory and Analysis
courses.description: Selected studies in music theory, comparative theory, history of music theory, acoustics and aesthetics.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in Doctor of Music, Master of Music, MPhil Music or PhD Music

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: M.Phil./M.Mus. Thesis/Portfolio Preparation
courses.description: MPhil/MMus students are required to enroll for the course each term throughout the thesis/portfolio preparation. Students who take this course beyond their minimum period of study are not required to pay full tuition fee.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in Master of Music or MPhil Music

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Ph.D./D.Mus. Dissertation/Portfolio Preparation
courses.description: PhD/DMus students are required to enroll the course each term throughout the dissertation/portfolio preparation. Students who take this course beyond their minimum period of study are not required to pay full tuition fee.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in Doctor of Music or PhD Music
